abstracts.cdata!:
The Eleventh Imports Program Credit
            Project will support improvements in domestic resource
            mobilization and budgetary management, in agricultural and
            food policies, and in trade and industrial policies. The
            credit will provide foreign exchange to finance essential
            imports. The credit will be available for disbursement in
            two tranches: US$ 55 million on effectiveness and another
            US$ 55 million subject to a review of the Government's
            economic development policies, in particular the
            implementation of the Government's public investment
            budget. This review is to take place not later than April
            15, 1983.
